title: Frank Lampard told senior Chelsea players to ‘step up’ in crunch meeting
text:
The Blues boss wanted the team’s more experienced players to contribute more (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea’s recent upturn in form can be partly attributed to manager Frank Lampard urging the side’s senior players to ‘step up’ rather than relying on the club’s in-form youngsters.

The Blues lost back-to-back matches against Valencia and Liverpool in September – both at Stamford Bridge – through won their subsequent two Premier League outings and picked up a vital Champions League away win in Lille.

Although Chelsea’s academy graduates have stolen the headlines, there have been notably contributions from the likes of Willian and Pedro more recently.

Lampard wanted the likes of Willian to contribute more (Picture: Getty)

And according to the Daily Mail, Lampard and assistant Jody Morris took some of Chelsea’s senior players aside and told them to ‘stop leaving it to the youngsters to secure wins’.

Lampard had been frustrated with the performances of the more experienced players in the squad and wanted to put pressure on them to improve.

Since that crunch meeting, Willian, Pedro, Michy Batshuayi and Ross Barkley have all scored as the Blues have racked up four straight wins in all competitions, scoring 15 times.

Although Chelsea’s youngsters have made excellent starts to the new season, Lampard is conscious that they cannot carry the burden of winning matches on their own.

Olivier Giroud will also be called on to share the goalscoring burden with Tammy Abraham, even though the England striker has been in superb form, and Lampard knows there may come a time when the Frenchman will need to step up.

Lampard and Morris were keen to try and gee up the side’s senior players (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea’s fine recent form has seen four players called up to the latest England squad for Euro 2020 qualifiers against Czech Republic and Bulgaria.

Fikayo Tomori is in line to be handed his first cap for England having previously played for the Canada Under-20 side, while Mason Mount, Ross Barkley and Abraham are also competing to play.
